Get in line for vaccination, and continue to consider the impact of our actions on others. We can beat it together.

Yet, the numbers would be much higher if we didn't follow CDC guidelines. Many have avoided exposure because they did the right thing. And a few of us, but only a few, got COVID-19 while doing the right thing.  The odds are still in doing the right thing. So let's keep it up...

The virus can seem random, but it isn't.  It is true that it can reach anyone, but we know that wearing a mask and practicing social distancing reduces the virus' reach. Science doesn't guarantee 100% protection. I am proof of that...

Beyond the numbers, COVID-19 is still personal.  In the last 10 days, we lost the famous (Dawn Wells of Gilligan's Island fame), the future (Rep-elect Luke Letlow, age 41) and the friends (my neighbor in Everett dies 6 days after getting a positive test.)

In the last 10 days, the US has seen 1,927,988 new cases; 19,730 in our state.  Is there good news? Rates of infection dropped from 64.7/100k to 54.4/100k in the US; in our state, rates dropped from 42.8/100k to 22.8/100k. Rates seemed headed in the right direction, but...
In the last 10 days, I have stayed symptom-free. No fever, no chills. I am very fortunate. In the last 10 days, 25,228 people have dies in the US from COVID-19; 316 in Washington state.

My Covid time has been easier for me than most.  The window to my backyard doubled as BirdTV. I identified 15 bird species, including a Northern Flicker, a nonbreeding female American Goldfinch and a white-throatwd sparrow (i.d.'d by its white throat; who knew?)
Today is my Get Out of Covid Jail day. Per CDC guidelines, I have spent 10 days in non-splendid isolation. It is a new year in more ways than one.

Wishing you all a happy, safe, and prosperous new year!!!

Senator Joe Neal was more than a legislator. He was a statesman and a dedicated public servant. His achievements will be remembered by all those with whom he shared his knowledge, legislative prowess and experience. The legacy of a champion – The Westside Slugger. 4/4

As an intern, I remember watching in amazement as he delivered passionate speeches from the floor, hardly ever using prepared remarks. He was a master parliamentarian and laid groundwork for many NV legislative milestones, such as passing the #EqualRightsAmendment. 3/4

Following his retirement, I was honored to represent NV Senate District 4, which he had so capably represented for 32 years. That same district is now represented by his youngest daughter, Dina @senator_neal, who continues to carry on his legacy of public service. 2/4
